page.title: 09EDUCATION AT STOKE ON TERN
page.content: {SCHOOL HISTORY (CONT) Children learning to write started on slates and then moved on to paper. Nowadays the main subjects are read- ing,language and maths but the whole of the curriculum is important. History, Geography and Science are often taught as inter-related subjects. The children use the immediate environment as a starting point.Music, Drama, Movement, Physical Education and Games are all included on the timetable.Religion does not play as important a part, but it sets the moral standard. Today there are 104 children, 4 teachers and the Headmistress. There are 4 classes. The Headmistress is not class-based. A cook and assistant are employed, hot meals are served each day. Also there is a secretary and a caretaker who work for the school.
